alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued February 23 at 1:40PM PST until February 24 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 9 AM PST THURSDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 degrees expected Thursday morning. Friday morning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. * WHERE...Central Valley and adjacent foothills below 2,000 feet. * WHEN...For the Hard Freeze Warning, from 1 AM to 9 AM PST Thursday. For the Freeze Warning Friday, 1 AM PST to 9 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Thursday morning will see the coldest temperatures when lows are forecast to drop into the mid 20s for a significant portion of the Central Valley for more than 3 hours.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
